title: How to Make Steamed Hilsa or Ilish Bhapa

methods.name: Making Mustard Paste (Shorshe Bata) and Sauce

steps.headline: Soak first.
steps.description: Put the 2 tablespoons of mustard seeds (shorshe), 2 teaspoons of poppy seeds (posto), and 3-4 hot green chilis in less than 1/2 cup of water for 10-15 minutes.

steps.headline: Grind the above with little salt to make a thick mustard paste.
Put the mustard paste in a bowl.
steps.description:
Add:
1 heaped teaspoon yogurt
2 teaspoon mustard oil
1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder
1/4 teaspoon red chili powder (optional)
salt to taste

steps.headline: Mix the ingredients well.
steps.description: This is the mustard sauce you will use for the fish.

steps.headline: Wash and clean 5-6 pieces of Hilsa/Ilish
Cut them in steak-size pieces.
Smear an oven safe bowl with little mustard oil.
Place the fish pieces in the bowl in one single layer.
Pour the prepared mustard sauce over it so that it covers all the fish pieces nicely.
Add 3-4 slit green chili on the top and drizzle 1 teaspoon or more of mustard oil on them.
Cover the bowl with an aluminium foil.
At 375 F, bake for 25-30 minutes.
While baking, after the first 10-15 minutes, remove the foil cover.
steps.description: For the remaining 15 minutes, let it bake open.

steps.headline: Serve hot with rice.
Wash and clean 5-6 pieces of Hilsa/Ilish
Cut them in steak-size pieces.
Smear an pressure cooker safe bowl with little mustard oil.
Place the fish pieces in the bowl in one single layer.
Pour the prepared mustard sauce over it so that it covers all the fish pieces nicely.
Add 3-4 slit green chili on the top and drizzle 1 teaspoon or more of mustard oil on them.
Cook in pressure cooker for 2-3 whistles.

text:
Making Mustard Paste (Shorshe Bata) and Sauce Soak first. Put the 2 tablespoons of mustard seeds (shorshe), 2 teaspoons of poppy seeds (posto), and 3-4 hot green chilis in less than 1/2 cup of water for 10-15 minutes. Grind the above with little salt to make a thick mustard paste.  Put the mustard paste in a bowl. Add:
1 heaped teaspoon yogurt
2 teaspoon mustard oil
1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder
1/4 teaspoon red chili powder (optional)
salt to taste Mix the ingredients well. This is the mustard sauce you will use for the fish. Cooking in the Oven Wash and clean 5-6 pieces of Hilsa/Ilish  Cut them in steak-size pieces.  Smear an oven safe bowl with little mustard oil.  Place the fish pieces in the bowl in one single layer.  Pour the prepared mustard sauce over it so that it covers all the fish pieces nicely.  Add 3-4 slit green chili on the top and drizzle 1 teaspoon or more of mustard oil on them.  Cover the bowl with an aluminium foil.  At 375 F, bake for 25-30 minutes.  While baking, after the first 10-15 minutes, remove the foil cover. For the remaining 15 minutes, let it bake open. Serve hot with rice.  Cooking in the Pressure Cooker Wash and clean 5-6 pieces of Hilsa/Ilish  Cut them in steak-size pieces.  Smear an pressure cooker safe bowl with little mustard oil.  Place the fish pieces in the bowl in one single layer.  Pour the prepared mustard sauce over it so that it covers all the fish pieces nicely.  Add 3-4 slit green chili on the top and drizzle 1 teaspoon or more of mustard oil on them.  Cook in pressure cooker for 2-3 whistles.
